meaning: A set of instructions to complete a task or solve a problem
The process of dividing a problem into more manageable sub-problems, which are then divided further and so on.
The process of removing unnecessary details from a problem to focus on the important parts
A notation resembling a programming language, used to describe the steps in an algorithm or the logic flow of an algorithm
A type of diagram using arrows and boxes, which allows the programmer to visualise an algorithm before it is turned into code.
The data that is sent to a program to be processed
The application of an algorithm to inputted data.
The data that is sent out of a program to be shown to the user.
The amount of time and/or resources required to complete a task
An algorithm that locates a specific item in a dataset
An algorithm that sorts a dataset into a specific order
A searching algorithm that searches through a dataset one at a time, until the item is found
A searching algorithm that recursively splits the dataset in half and compares the item to be found to the item halfway through the dataset.
A sorting algorithm that compares two items at a time, swapping them if they are in the wrong order, until the entire dataset is sorted.
A sorting algorithm that recursively splits a dataset into two halves, sorts each one separately and merges the two sorted lists back together.
A sorting algorithm which moves each item left until the item to its left is less than it.
